text.autoconfig.shutter.title: Shutter Configuration
config.shutter.genSettings.@Tooltip: Settings regarding the interpolation, playback and properties of camera paths.
config.shutter.genSettings.pathTime.@Too: Sets the default time the path takes to complete. Overwritten by the start command. In ticks.
config.shutter.genSettings.curveDetail.@: Set the detail level of the curve interpolation for generated paths.
config.shutter.genSettings.hideEntityLab: Set whether entity labels are shown during path following.
config.shutter.genSettings.hideArmorStan: Set whether invisible armor stands show up as translucent in spectator.
config.shutter.pathSettings.@Tooltip: Settings regarding the Visualization of the Camera Path .
config.shutter.pathSettings.showNodeHead: Set whether or not to display a camera object on nodes, indicating their rotation and position.
config.shutter.pathSettings.nodeTranspar: Set the transparency of Path Nodes.
config.shutter.pathSettings.showDirectio: Renders an additional line on Path Nodes, indicating direction.
config.shutter.pathSettings.pathStyle.@T: Set the style in which the path between nodes is rendered during visualization.
config.shutter.pathSettings.pathColour.@: Set the colour in which the path between nodes is rendered during visualization.
msg.shutter.error.not_enough_start: At least 2 nodes are required to preview the path!
msg.shutter.error.not_enough_show: At least 2 nodes are required to visualize the path!
msg.shutter.error.go_to_node: Unable to go to Node #%d. It doesn't exist.
msg.shutter.error.set_node: Unable to replace Node #%d; It doesn't exist.
msg.shutter.error.remove_node: Unable to remove Node #%d; It already doesn't exist.
msg.shutter.help.arg.index.desc: Target node index, node count starts with 0.
msg.shutter.help.cmd.start: Begin following the defined camera path.
msg.shutter.help.cmd.stop: End following the defined camera path.
msg.shutter.help.cmd.add: Adds the current camera state as a new node to the path.
msg.shutter.help.cmd.set: Replaces the defined node with the current camera state.
msg.shutter.help.cmd.remove: Removes the defined node from the current path.
msg.shutter.help.cmd.goto: Teleports to the defined node, and adjusts the camera.
